articles.title: French Shopping Vocabulary: Complete Guide for Couples
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Shopping in French is both practical and romantic - whether you're browsing Parisian boutiques, exploring local markets, or simply picking up groceries together. Mastering shopping vocabulary will help you navigate stores, find the perfect gifts for each other, and enjoy the full French shopping experience as a couple.

## Entering a Store

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Bonjour, je regarde juste"
  translation="Hello, I'm just looking"
  pronunciation="[bon-ZHOOR zhuh ruh-GARD zhoost]"
  context="The perfect phrase when a shop assistant approaches - polite but non-committal"
/>

### Basic Greetings and Responses

Always greet shop staff when entering and leaving!

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Bonjour! | Hello! |
| Bonsoir! | Good evening! |
| Je regarde, merci | I'm just looking, thanks |
| Je cherche... | I'm looking for... |
| Est-ce que vous pouvez m'aider? | Can you help me? |
| Au revoir! | Goodbye! |
| Bonne journee! | Have a nice day! |

<VocabCard
  word="Excusez-moi, est-ce que vous avez ca en bleu?"
  translation="Excuse me, do you have this in blue?"
  pronunciation="[ex-koo-ZAY-mwah ess-kuh voo za-VAY sah ahn BLUH]"
  example="Excusez-moi, j'adore ce pull. Est-ce que vous avez ca en bleu?"
/>

<CultureTip title="French Shopping Etiquette" flag="ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·">
In France, always say "Bonjour" when entering a store and "Au revoir" when leaving - even if you don't buy anything. This politeness is essential and expected. Shop assistants may seem distant at first, but greeting them properly opens the door to helpful service.
</CultureTip>

## Types of Stores

### Les Magasins (Stores)

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| La boulangerie | Bakery |
| La patisserie | Pastry shop |
| La boucherie | Butcher shop |
| La charcuterie | Deli/Cold cuts shop |
| La fromagerie | Cheese shop |
| La poissonnerie | Fish market |
| L'epicerie | Grocery store |
| Le supermarche | Supermarket |
| Le marche | Market |
| La pharmacie | Pharmacy |
| La librairie | Bookstore |
| La bijouterie | Jewelry store |
| Le magasin de vetements | Clothing store |
| Le grand magasin | Department store |
| La parfumerie | Perfume shop |

<VocabCard
  word="On va faire les courses au marche?"
  translation="Shall we go shopping at the market?"
  pronunciation="[on vah fair lay KOORS oh mar-SHAY]"
  example="C'est samedi! On va faire les courses au marche?"
/>

## Asking About Products

### Finding What You Need

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Est-ce que vous avez...? | Do you have...? |
| Ou se trouve...? | Where is...? |
| Je cherche... | I'm looking for... |
| Vous vendez...? | Do you sell...? |
| C'est dans quel rayon? | Which aisle is it in? |
| Vous en avez d'autres? | Do you have others? |

<VocabCard
  word="Excusez-moi, ou se trouve le rayon parfumerie?"
  translation="Excuse me, where is the perfume section?"
  pronunciation="[ex-koo-ZAY-mwah oo suh TROOV luh ray-ON par-foom-REE]"
  example="Excusez-moi, je cherche un cadeau. Ou se trouve le rayon parfumerie?"
/>

### Size and Colors

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Quelle taille? | What size? |
| Petit / Moyen / Grand | Small / Medium / Large |
| C'est trop grand / petit | It's too big / small |
| Vous l'avez en quelle taille? | What sizes do you have? |
| La taille au-dessus / au-dessous | The size up / down |

| French Colors | English |
|--------------|---------|
| Noir | Black |
| Blanc | White |
| Rouge | Red |
| Bleu | Blue |
| Vert | Green |
| Jaune | Yellow |
| Rose | Pink |
| Violet | Purple |
| Orange | Orange |
| Gris | Gray |
| Marron | Brown |
| Beige | Beige |

<VocabCard
  word="C'est trop petit. Vous l'avez en taille au-dessus?"
  translation="It's too small. Do you have it in the next size up?"
  pronunciation="[say troh puh-TEE voo lah-VAY ahn TIE oh-duh-SOO]"
  example="Cette robe est magnifique mais c'est trop petit. Vous l'avez en taille au-dessus?"
/>

## Trying Things On

### Clothing Shopping

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Ou sont les cabines d'essayage? | Where are the fitting rooms? |
| Je peux l'essayer? | Can I try it on? |
| Ca me va? | Does it suit me? |
| Ca te va tres bien! | It suits you very well! |
| C'est parfait! | It's perfect! |
| Je le/la prends | I'll take it |
| Je vais reflechir | I'll think about it |

<VocabCard
  word="Mon amour, ca te va a merveille!"
  translation="My love, it looks wonderful on you!"
  pronunciation="[mon ah-MOOR sah tuh vah ah mehr-VAY]"
  example="Garde cette robe, mon amour, ca te va a merveille!"
/>

### Shopping Together Phrases

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Qu'est-ce que tu en penses? | What do you think? |
| Ca me va bien? | Does it look good on me? |
| Tu aimes? | Do you like it? |
| C'est trop / pas assez... | It's too / not enough... |
| Essaie celui-la! | Try that one! |
| Tu es magnifique! | You look gorgeous! |
| Je t'achete ca comme cadeau | I'm buying this for you as a gift |

<CultureTip title="French Fashion Culture" flag="ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·">
French people generally value quality over quantity in fashion. They often build capsule wardrobes with classic pieces. When shopping with your French partner, compliments are appreciated but expected to be honest - "C'est pas mal" (It's not bad) actually means it's pretty good!
</CultureTip>

## Asking About Prices

<VocabCard
  word="Ca coute combien?"
  translation="How much does it cost?"
  pronunciation="[sah KOOT kohm-bee-AHN]"
  example="Pardon, ca coute combien, cette echarpe?"
/>

### Price Vocabulary

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| C'est combien? | How much is it? |
| Ca fait combien? | How much does that come to? |
| Quel est le prix? | What's the price? |
| C'est en solde | It's on sale |
| C'est cher | It's expensive |
| C'est bon marche | It's cheap/affordable |
| C'est une bonne affaire | It's a good deal |
| C'est hors de prix | It's overpriced |
| Il y a une reduction? | Is there a discount? |

### Understanding Prices

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Ca fait 25 euros | That's 25 euros |
| Le total est de... | The total is... |
| Taxe comprise | Tax included |
| Prix unitaire | Unit price |
| Prix au kilo | Price per kilo |

<VocabCard
  word="C'est un peu cher, il y a une reduction possible?"
  translation="It's a bit expensive, is there a possible discount?"
  pronunciation="[say tuhn puh SHEHR eel ee ah oon ray-dook-see-ON poh-SEEBL]"
  example="On adore cet article mais c'est un peu cher. Il y a une reduction possible?"
/>

## At the Market

### Market Shopping Phrases

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Je voudrais... | I would like... |
| Donnez-moi... | Give me... |
| Un kilo de... | A kilo of... |
| Une livre de... | A pound of... |
| Une tranche de... | A slice of... |
| Un morceau de... | A piece of... |
| C'est tout, merci | That's all, thanks |
| Et avec ceci? | Anything else? |

<VocabCard
  word="Je voudrais un kilo de tomates et une botte de basilic"
  translation="I would like a kilo of tomatoes and a bunch of basil"
  pronunciation="[zhuh voo-DRAY uhn KEE-loh duh toh-MAHT ay oon BOTT duh bah-zee-LEEK]"
  example="Bonjour! Je voudrais un kilo de tomates et une botte de basilic, s'il vous plait."
/>

### Fresh Produce Vocabulary

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Les fruits | Fruits |
| Les legumes | Vegetables |
| Les pommes | Apples |
| Les oranges | Oranges |
| Les fraises | Strawberries |
| Les tomates | Tomatoes |
| Les carottes | Carrots |
| Les pommes de terre | Potatoes |
| Les oignons | Onions |
| L'ail | Garlic |
| Le fromage | Cheese |
| Le pain | Bread |
| La viande | Meat |
| Le poisson | Fish |

<CultureTip title="French Market Culture" flag="ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·">
French markets are a social experience! Vendors often let you taste before buying (especially cheese and charcuterie). Don't touch the produce without asking - point and let the vendor select for you. Bring your own bag (un sac) as plastic bags are rare. Markets typically run until 12:30-13:00.
</CultureTip>

## Paying

### At the Register

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Je voudrais payer | I'd like to pay |
| Ou est la caisse? | Where is the register? |
| Vous acceptez les cartes? | Do you accept cards? |
| Je paie en especes | I'm paying cash |
| Je paie par carte | I'm paying by card |
| Le code PIN | The PIN code |
| Un sac, s'il vous plait | A bag, please |
| Le recu | The receipt |
| Je peux avoir un recu? | Can I have a receipt? |

<VocabCard
  word="Vous acceptez les cartes de credit?"
  translation="Do you accept credit cards?"
  pronunciation="[voo zak-sep-TAY lay KART duh kray-DEE]"
  example="Avant de payer - vous acceptez les cartes de credit?"
/>

### Sales and Discounts

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Les soldes | Sales |
| Une promotion | A promotion |
| En solde | On sale |
| -20% (moins vingt pour cent) | 20% off |
| Deux pour le prix d'un | Two for the price of one |
| Offre speciale | Special offer |
| Prix reduit | Reduced price |

## Gift Shopping

### Finding the Perfect Gift

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Je cherche un cadeau pour... | I'm looking for a gift for... |
| C'est pour offrir | It's to give as a gift |
| Vous pouvez l'emballer? | Can you wrap it? |
| Vous faites les paquets cadeaux? | Do you do gift wrapping? |
| C'est pour mon/ma partenaire | It's for my partner |
| Quelque chose de special | Something special |
| Un cadeau romantique | A romantic gift |

<VocabCard
  word="Je cherche un cadeau special pour ma femme"
  translation="I'm looking for a special gift for my wife"
  pronunciation="[zhuh SHEHRSH uhn kah-DOH spay-see-AL poor mah FAHM]"
  example="Bonjour, je cherche un cadeau special pour ma femme. C'est notre anniversaire."
/>

### Gift Ideas Vocabulary

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Un bijou | A piece of jewelry |
| Un collier | A necklace |
| Un bracelet | A bracelet |
| Des boucles d'oreilles | Earrings |
| Une bague | A ring |
| Un parfum | A perfume |
| Une echarpe | A scarf |
| Des fleurs | Flowers |
| Du chocolat | Chocolate |
| Un livre | A book |

## Returns and Exchanges

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Je voudrais echanger ceci | I'd like to exchange this |
| Je voudrais me faire rembourser | I'd like a refund |
| J'ai le ticket de caisse | I have the receipt |
| Ca ne me va pas | It doesn't fit me |
| C'est defectueux | It's defective |
| Quelle est votre politique de retour? | What's your return policy? |

<VocabCard
  word="Excusez-moi, je voudrais echanger cet article"
  translation="Excuse me, I'd like to exchange this item"
  pronunciation="[ex-koo-ZAY-mwah zhuh voo-DRAY ay-shahn-ZHAY set ar-TEEKL]"
  example="Excusez-moi, je voudrais echanger cet article. C'est trop petit pour mon mari."
/>

## Couple's Shopping Activities

### Shopping Together Dialogue

**Partner A:** On entre dans cette boutique? Elle a l'air sympa!
**Partner B:** D'accord! Bonjour!
**Vendeur:** Bonjour! Je peux vous aider?
**Partner A:** On regarde, merci. Oh, regarde ca!
**Partner B:** C'est joli! Ca te plait?
**Partner A:** Oui! C'est combien?
**Partner B:** Essaie-le! Ou sont les cabines?
**Vendeur:** Au fond a droite.
*[After trying on]*
**Partner B:** Waouh, ca te va super bien!
**Partner A:** Tu trouves? Je le prends alors!

### Planning Shopping Together

| French | English |
|--------|---------|
| Qu'est-ce qu'on doit acheter? | What do we need to buy? |
| On fait la liste des courses | Let's make a shopping list |
| Tu veux venir avec moi? | Do you want to come with me? |
| On fait du shopping ensemble? | Shall we go shopping together? |
| J'ai besoin de ton avis | I need your opinion |

<VocabCard
  word="Viens avec moi, j'ai besoin de ton avis!"
  translation="Come with me, I need your opinion!"
  pronunciation="[vee-AHN ah-vek MWAH zhay buh-ZWAN duh ton ah-VEE]"
  example="Je veux acheter une nouvelle veste. Viens avec moi, j'ai besoin de ton avis!"
/>

## Quick Reference: Essential Shopping Phrases

| Situation | French |
|-----------|--------|
| Entering store | Bonjour! |
| Just looking | Je regarde, merci |
| Asking for help | Est-ce que vous pouvez m'aider? |
| Asking price | C'est combien? / Ca coute combien? |
| Asking for size | Vous l'avez en taille...? |
| Trying on | Je peux l'essayer? |
| Taking it | Je le/la prends |
| Paying | Je voudrais payer |
| Leaving | Au revoir, bonne journee! |

Bonne shopping! Enjoy exploring stores and markets together in French!

<CTA text="Ready to shop in French?" buttonText="Start Learning Now" />

articles.title: 50+ Nomi di Coccole Romeni per il Tuo Partner: Il Linguaggio dell'Amore
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Immagina di guardare il tuo partner negli occhi e sussurrargli una parola romena che significa "amore mio" - magico, vero? I nomi di coccole romeni non sono solo parole dolci, sono ponti culturali che avvicinano i cuori. Che il tuo partner sia rumeno o che vogliate semplicemente aggiungere un tocco esotico alla vostra relazione, questi termini di affetto vi aiuteranno a creare momenti intimi unici. Per [altre frasi romantiche in romeno](/learn/it/ro/romantic-romanian-phrases-for-every-occasion/), abbiamo una guida completa che fa per voi.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Iubirea mea"
  translation="Il mio amore"
  pronunciation="yoo-BEE-reh-ah MEH-ah"
  context="Il termine di affetto piÃ¹ classico e romantico, perfetto per momenti intimi."
/>

## I Classici dell'Amore: I 10 Termini PiÃ¹ Usati

Questi nomi di coccole sono i preferiti delle coppie rumene. Usali con il tuo partner e sentirai la magia dell'amore romeno!

<VocabCard
  word="DragÄƒ"
  translation="Caro/Cara"
  pronunciation="DRAH-guh"
  example="DragÄƒ mea, eÈ™ti totul pentru mine."
/>

| Romeno | Italiano | Pronuncia | Quando Usarlo |
|--------|----------|-----------|---------------|
| **Iubirea mea** | Il mio amore | yoo-BEE-reh-ah MEH-ah | Momenti romantici |
| **DragÄƒ** | Caro/Cara | DRAH-guh | Quotidianamente |
| **Draga mea** | Mia cara | DRAH-guh MEH-ah | Con affetto |
| **Iubitule** | Amore mio (a lui) | yoo-BEE-too-leh | Chiamare il partner |
| **Iubita mea** | La mia amata | yoo-BEE-tah MEH-ah | Per la fidanzata |
| **Scumpa mea** | La mia preziosa | SCOOM-pah MEH-ah | Tenerezza |
| **Scumpe** | Prezioso/a | SCOOM-peh | Affectionato |
| **Inimioara mea** | Il mio cuoricino | nee-mee-oh-AH-rah MEH-ah | Dolce e tenero |
| **ViaÈ›a mea** | La mia vita | VYAH-tsah MEH-ah | Molto intenso |
| **Soarele meu** | Il mio sole | SWAH-reh-leh MEH-oo | Appassionato |

## Animali Carini: Nomi di Coccole Inspired dalla Natura

I rumeni amano usare animali dolci per esprimere affetto - sono teneri e creativi!

<VocabCard
  word="PisoiaÈ™ul meu"
  translation="Il mio micino"
  pronunciation="pee-SWAH-shool MEH-oo"
  example="PisoiaÈ™ul meu, vino qui!"
/>

| Romeno | Italiano | Pronuncia | Significato |
|--------|----------|-----------|-------------|
| **PisoiaÈ™ul meu** | Il mio micino | pee-SWAH-shool MEH-oo | Tenero come un gattino |
| **CÄƒÈ›elul meu** | Il mio cagnolino | kuh-tseh-LOOL MEH-oo | Affettuoso come un cucciolo |
| **IepuraÈ™ul meu** | Il mio coniglietto | yeh-poo-RAH-shool MEH-oo | Dolce e timido |
| **UrsuleÈ›ul meu** | Il mio orsetto | oor-soo-LEH-tsool MEH-oo | Caldo e protettivo |
| **PÄƒsÄƒrica mea** | Il mio uccellino | puh-suh-REE-kah MEH-ah | Delicato e grazioso |

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡´" title="Animali nell'Amore">
In Romania, i nomi di animali sono molto comuni tra innamorati. Non Ã¨ infantile - Ã¨ considerato tenero e affettuoso!
</CultureTip>

## Dolci Tentazioni: Nomi di Coccole di Cibo

Il cibo Ã¨ l'amore hanno sempre avuto una connessione speciale!

| Romeno | Italiano | Pronuncia | Quando Usare |
|--------|----------|-----------|--------------|
| **DulceaÈ›a mea** | Il mio dolcetto | dool-CHEH-ah-tsah MEH-ah | Per qualcuno dolce |
| **Miere** | Miele | MEE-eh-reh | Naturale e dolce |
| **Bombo** | Caramella | BOM-boh | Carino e piccolo |
| **PufuleÈ›** | Puffo dolce | poo-FOO-lehts | Morbido e soffice |
| **CiocolatÄƒ** | Cioccolato | choh-koh-LAH-tah | Ricco e desiderabile |

## Termini Unici: Espressioni Rumene Speciali

Alcuni termini romeni non hanno una traduzione diretta - sono unici e bellissimi!

<VocabCard
  word="Alint"
  translation="Coccola/carezza verbale"
  pronunciation="ah-LEENT"
  example="ÃÈ›i dau atÃ¢tea alinturi!"
/>

| Romeno | Italiano | Pronuncia | Significato Speciale |
|--------|----------|-----------|---------------------|
| **Alint** | Carezza/coccola | ah-LEENT | Tipo speciale di tenerezza |
| **Dor** | Nostalgia d'amore | dor | Desiderio profondo |
| **DrÄƒgÄƒlaÈ™** | Adorabile | druh-guh-LAHSH | Carino e amabile |
| **Scumpic** | Tesoro piccolo | SCOOM-peek | Versione tenera di "prezioso" |

## Nomi Maschili vs Femminili: Attenzione alla Grammatica!

In romeno, i nomi di coccole cambiano leggermente a seconda del genere del partner. Se vuoi approfondire la [grammatica romena di base](/learn/it/ro/romanian-grammar-basics/), abbiamo una guida completa.

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡´" title="Genere e Affetto">
Quando usi "scump" (prezioso), diventa "scumpÄƒ" per una donna. Questo vale per molti termini romeni - il linguaggio dell'amore Ã¨ grammaticale!
</CultureTip>

### Per Lui (Maschile)
- **DrÄƒguÈ›ul meu** (DRUH-goot-sool MEH-oo) - Il mio carino
- **Scumpul meu** (SCOOM-pool MEH-oo) - Il mio prezioso
- **Iubitul meu** (yoo-BEE-tool MEH-oo) - Il mio amato

### Per Lei (Femminile)
- **DrÄƒguÈ›a mea** (DRUH-goot-sah MEH-ah) - La mia carina
- **Scumpa mea** (SCOOM-pah MEH-ah) - La mia preziosa
- **Iubita mea** (yoo-BEE-tah MEH-ah) - La mia amata

## Nomi di Coccole Creativi: Originali e Divertenti

Per le coppie che amano essere uniche e creative!

| Romeno | Italiano | Pronuncia | Stile |
|--------|----------|-----------|--------|
| **SteluÈ›a mea** | La mia stellina | steh-LOO-tzah MEH-ah | Romantico |
| **LuminiÈ›a mea** | La mia lucina | loo-mee-NEE-tzah MEH-ah | Poetico |
| **Comoara mea** | Il mio tesoro | koh-moh-AH-rah MEH-ah | Intenso |
| **BucÄƒÈ›ica mea** | Il mio pezzetto | boo-kuh-TSee-kah MEH-ah | Giocherellone |
| **Atingerea mea** | Il mio tocco speciale | ah-teen-GEH-reh-ah MEH-ah | Sensuale |

## Come Usare i Nomi di Coccole con il Tuo Partner

### Contesti Perfetti
- **Mattino**: "BunÄƒ dimineaÈ›a, iubirea mea!" (Buongiorno, amore mio!)
- **Telefono**: "Ce faci, dragÄƒ?" (Cosa fai, caro?)
- **Messaggi**: "Mi-e dor de tine, pisoiaÈ™ul meu" (Mi manchi, mio micino)

### Errori da Evitare
1. **Non esagerare** - Usali con moderazione per non perderne l'effetto
2. **Rispetta il contesto** - Evita nomi troppo teneri in pubblico se il tuo partner Ã¨ timido
3. **Impara la pronuncia** - Niente rompe la magia come una pronuncia sbagliata!

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡´" title="Timing Ã¨ Tutto">
I rumeni tendono ad usare i nomi di coccole piÃ¹ frequentemente nelle relazioni consolidate. Non avere fretta - lascia che il vostro amore cresca naturalmente!
</CultureTip>

## Creare i Vostri Nomi Speciali

La bellezza dell'amore Ã¨ che puÃ² creare tradizioni uniche. PerchÃ© non create insieme il vostro nome di coccola romeno personale? Mischiate i vostri nomi, aggiungete "mio/mia" e create qualcosa di unico. Se vuoi [imparare piÃ¹ frasi quotidiane per le coppie](/learn/it/ro/romanian-daily-conversations-couples/), abbiamo tante risorse per voi.

Ricorda: i nomi di coccole romeni non sono solo parole - sono piccoli atti d'amore quotidiani che tengono vivo il fuoco della passione. Ogni "iubirea mea" sussurrato Ã¨ un investimento nel vostro futuro insieme.

<CTA />

Men her er det magiske: NÃ¥r du snakker deres sprÃ¥k - selv bare noen fÃ¥ hjertelige fraser - Ã¥pner dÃ¸rene seg pÃ¥ vidt gap. Plutselig er du ikke bare "kjÃ¦resten til barnet deres", du er noen som virkelig bryr seg nok til Ã¥ lÃ¦re. Dette er din sjanse til Ã¥ vise at du elsker ikke bare deres sÃ¸nn eller datter, men hele deres kultur.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Muito prazer em conhecÃª-lo/a"

## FÃ¸r du drar: Forbered deg med hjertet
